summary: The Forest Data Modernization Act of 2025 amends the Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Research Act of 1978. It focuses on improving the Forest Inventory and Analysis program by updating data collection methods, including timber product output studies and woodland owner surveys.  The bill mandates a strategic plan update to improve data precision, integrate carbon data, collaborate with partners, and increase transparency.  It also addresses data accessibility, confidentiality, and external data requests, along with requiring biennial reports and the use of remote sensing technologies.
